intro: Chorispora gracilis, commonly known as slender chorispora, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its small, upright growth habit and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy surface. Chorispora gracilis is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
